title: Lok Satta Movement
text:
Lok Satta is a non-partisan movement for <a href="Democracy">democratic</a> reforms in the country of <a href="India">India</a>, led by <a href="Jayaprakash%20Narayan%20%28Lok%20Satta%29">Dr. Jayaprakash Narayan</a>, a former <a href="Indian%20Administrative%20Service">I. A. S.</a> officer and renowned activist from <a href="Andhra%20Pradesh">Andhra Pradesh</a>, <a href="India">India</a>. The movement was started in 1996 with the founding of Lok Satta, a <a href="non-governmental%20organization">non-governmental organization</a>. In 2006, the movement transformed into <a href="Lok%20Satta%20Party">Lok Satta Party</a>.
Introduction.
The group declared to form a political party and contest in the upcoming elections. Though the movement initially started in <a href="Andhra%20Pradesh">Andhra Pradesh</a>, it later spread across the country. Dr. Jayaprakash Narayan says that <a href="democracy">democracy</a> is for the people, of the people and by the people. Lok Satta is a registered society whose membership is open and available to all Indians. It has district branches and neighbourhood units spread all over <a href="Andhra%20Pradesh">Andhra Pradesh</a>. It has over 250,000 members in the state and over 30,000 in the Greater <a href="Hyderabad%2C%20Andhra%20Pradesh">Hyderabad</a> region. While Lok Satta's goals are governance reforms in <a href="India">India</a>, its organizational spread is largely in <a href="Andhra%20Pradesh">Andhra Pradesh</a>.
Activities.
Apart from creating India’s largest base for a people’s movement in Andhra Pradesh, Lok Satta is now deeply engaged in building a viable national platform for democratic reforms through building alliances in major states and promoting local initiatives, and building an effective and highly credible <a href="coalition">coalition</a> at the national level specifically for electoral reforms. It has also launched its political party arm in October 2007, which has met with reasonable success.
